Annotation.String: This schema defines a storage subsystem and its respective properties. A storage subsystem represents a set of storage controllers (physical or virtual) and the resources such as volumes that can be accessed from that subsystem.
This resource shall be used to represent resources that represent a storage subsystem in the Redfish specification.
This is the schema definition for the Update Service. It represents the properties for the service itself and has link to a collection of inventory.
This resource shall be used to represent an Update Service for a Redfish implementation. It represents the properties that affect the service itself and all update packages.
A unique identifier for the device class associated with this firmware.
The value of this property shall be a unique identifier for the device class associated with this inventory. For example, UEFI GUID or similar.
An opaque string to uniquely identify an instance of a device class.
The value of this property shall be an opaque string to uniquely identify an instance of a device class. For example, UEFI Device Path, UUID, MAC Address.
An opaque string to provide context for the device class.
The value of this property shall be an opaque string to provide context for the device class. For example, PCI bus 0 Device 19.
A string representing the version of this firmware.
The value of this property shall be a string representing the version of this firmware.
A description of the version string structure or format.
The value of this property shall be a description of the version string structure or format.
Indicates whether this firmware can be updated by the update service.
The value of this property shall be a boolean indicating whether this firmware can be updated by the update service. If false, this firmware is for reporting purpose only.
The Actions object contains the available custom actions on this resource.
